channel.title: iOS on Umair's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in iOS on Umair's Blog

item.title: Manual Memory Management in Objective-C
item.description: Objective-C on iOS has no garbage collector, so it is up to the programmer to make sure that memory is properly freed once an object is no longer needed. On the other hand, Objective-C on the Mac does have a garbage collector (in Objective C 2.0). This blog post focuses on how to manage memory in the absence of a garbage collector.
